p: The identity of the three active zones (A, B, and C) present in the upper part of the TLC plate (terpene’s region, Figure 1) was successfully determined using a TLC-HPLC-MS approach. The volatile constituents were present in the documented mass spectra even when operating in the HPLC system, which means that they were successfully eluted out of the TLC-MS interface and a short chromatographic column by the mixture of water: acetonitrile (20:80 v/ v) with the addition of 0.1% of formic acid. The analyzed mass chromatograms ( Figure 2) showed significant homogenous peaks with distinct signals of ar-curcumene, α-sesquiphellandrene, and α-zingiberene. The identity of the last two compounds needed to be compared with the obtained GC-MS spectra, as both of them are characterized by the same molecular weight.
